com.soa.soap.message

Interface SOAPMessage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Message

    public interface SOAPMessage
extends Message, java.lang.Cloneable
    Message interface extension specifically modelling SOAP messages.
    Since:
    3.1

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface com.soa.message.Message

        addAttachment, canCarryBindingHeaders, canNormalize, getAttachments, getBindingURI, getContent, getContentType, getCorrelationID, getID, getProperties, getProperty, getPropertyNames, getSecuritySubject, getTransportHeaders, isNormalized, normalize, normalizeCopy, setAttachments, setContent, setContentType, setCorrelationID, setID, setProperties, setProperty, setSecuritySubject, setTransportHeaders

    • Method Detail

      • isVersionKnown

        boolean isVersionKnown()
        Returns whether the version of the message is known at this time. If the message has been configured with an entire envelope that hasn't been parsed and no version has been specified previously it would not be safe to assume a version and therefore the version would be unknown.
        Returns:
        true if known, false if not.

      • getVersion

        SOAPVersion getVersion()
                throws GException
        Returns the SOAP version. If the version is unknown (see isVersionKnown) calling this method may require parsing of the message.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if parsing was required to find the version and an error was encountered during that process.

      • setVersion

        void setVersion(SOAPVersion version)
         throws GException
        Changes the version of the message. WARNING: this must only be called when the version of the message is currently unknown. Changing the known version will case an error.
        Parameters:
        version - SOAPVersion.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if an attempt is made to change the known version of the message.

      • getBody

        SOAPElement getBody()
             throws GException
        Returns the body of the SOAP message.
        Returns:
        SOAPElement holding the body content.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to return the body. Maybe be caused by a badly formed SOAP message.

      • getBodyParts

        java.util.Iterator getBodyParts()
                         throws GException
        Get the body parts of the message as an iterator across all SOAPElements in the message. Use of an Iterator allow the internal implementation to parse on demand, allowing for potentially better performance characteristics than getBody().
        Returns:
        An Iterator over all SOAPElements in the SOAP Body.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to return the parts. Maybe caused by a badly formed SOAP message.

      • getBodyPartNames

        SOAPPartsIterator getBodyPartNames()
                            throws GException
        Gets the names of the body parts of the message. Names are returned in an Iterator to support on-demand parsing for high performance.
        Returns:
        Iterator of body part QNames. The Iterator MUST be closed to release the message resources before any other methods on this object can be called.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to return the part names. Maybe caused by a badly formed SOAP message.

      • createHeader

        SOAPElement createHeader(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
                  throws GException
        Creates an empty SOAP header holder that can be filled and then attached to the SOAP message using addHeader.
        Parameters:
        QName - QName of the header element.
        Returns:
        SOAPElement that will hold the SOAP header.
        Throws:
        GException - if unable to create the header.

      • createHeader

        SOAPElement createHeader(javax.xml.namespace.QName name,
                         java.lang.String prefix)
                  throws GException
        Creates an empty SOAP header holder that can be filled and then attached to the SOAP message using addHeader. This version of the method takes an additional prefix that will be used for the namespace of the header's QName.
        Parameters:
        QName - QName of the header element.
        prefix - Prefix of the header's namespace.
        Returns:
        SOAPElement that will hold the SOAP header.
        Throws:
        GException - if unable to create the header.

      • createHeader

        SOAPElement createHeader(org.w3c.dom.Element value)
                  throws GException
        Inserts the given Element as a SOAP header.
        Parameters:
        value - Element to be used as header.
        Returns:
        SOAPElement holding the header Element.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to create the header.

      • getHeader

        SOAPElement getHeader(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
               throws GException
        Returns the SOAP header with the given eleemnt QName.
        Parameters:
        name - QName of the header to return.
        Returns:
        SOAPElement holding the SOAP header, null if not found.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if an error occured trying to return the header. Probably due to a badly formed SOAP message.

      • removeHeader

        SOAPElement removeHeader(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
                  throws GException
        Removes the SOAP header with the given QName.
        Parameters:
        name - QName of the header to remove.
        Returns:
        SOAPElement holding the removed SOAP header content, null if not found.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to remove the header. Probably due to a badly formed SOAP message.

      • getHeaderNames

        java.util.Set getHeaderNames()
                      throws GException
        Returns the names of all SOAP headers.
        Returns:
        Set of SOAP header QNames. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the message, so if a name is removed from the Set, the header is removed from the message. Names cannot be added however.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to return the list. Probably due to a badly formed SOAP message.

      • getTransportProperty

        java.lang.Object getTransportProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns the transport specific property with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        Returns:
        Object value of the transport property, null if not found.

      • setTransportProperty

        void setTransportProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                          java.lang.Object property)
        Associates a transport specific property with the message. All transport properties added through this interface will also be available through the more general getProperty() method as a Map with a key of "com.soa.soap.message.TransportProperties".
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the transport specific property.
        property - Value of the property.

      • setTransportProperties

        void setTransportProperties(java.util.Map properties)
        Performs a one step replacement of transport properties. All transport properties added through this interface will also be available through the more general getProperty() method as a Map with a key of "com.soa.soap.message.TransportProperties".
        Parameters:
        properties - Map of transport properties.

      • hasChanged

        boolean hasChanged()
        Returns whether the message has changed since it was constructed.
        Returns:
        True if it has changed, false if it has not.

      • getEnvelope

        javax.xml.transform.Source getEnvelope()
                                throws GException
        Returns a Source representation of the SOAP envelope. WARNING: Do not make changes directly to the returned Source object without calling setEnvelope().
        Returns:
        Source holding the entire SOAP envelope.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to create the Source. Probably due to a badly formed SOAP message.

      • setEnvelope

        void setEnvelope(javax.xml.transform.Source envelope)
          throws GException
        Replaces the SOAP envelope entirely. Any modifications done through the header and body methods previously will be lost. Since the envelope could be from a different SOAP version than previously stated, the version of the message will be invalidated. To identify the version of the message, the envelope will have to be parsed. If the version of the envelope is known use Parameters:
        envelope - Source holding the new SOAP envelope.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to replace the envelope. Most likely due to an invalid SOAP envelope being input.

      • setEnvelope

        void setEnvelope(javax.xml.transform.Source envelope,
                 SOAPVersion version)
          throws GException
        Replaces the SOAP envelope entirely. Any modifications done through the header and body methods previously will be lost. The version of the envelope will be changed to the specified version.
        Parameters:
        envelope - Source holding the new SOAP envelope.
        version - SOAP version of the envelope.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to replace the envelope. Most likely due to an invalid SOAP envelope being input.

      • isFault

        boolean isFault()
         throws GException
        Returns whether or not this SOAP message is a fault.
        Specified by:
        isFault in interface Message
        Returns:
        true if SOAP fault, false if not.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if unable to determine if the message is a fault. Probably due to a badly formed SOAP message.

      • setStyle

        void setStyle(java.lang.String style)
        Sets the encoding style, RPC or DOCUMENT, of the message.
        Parameters:
        style - RPC or DOCUMENT.

      • getStyle

        java.lang.String getStyle()
        Returns the encoding style, RPC or DOCUMENT, of the message.
        Returns:
        RCP or DOCUMENT.

      • setMessageType

        void setMessageType(javax.xml.namespace.QName messageType)
        Sets the QName of the schema type of the message. Used in RPC style messages.
        Parameters:
        messageType - QName of the schema type.

      • getMessageType

        javax.xml.namespace.QName getMessageType()
        Returns the QName of the schema type of the message. Used in RPC style messages.
        Returns:
        QName of the schema type.

      • setMessageName

        void setMessageName(java.lang.String messageName)
        Sets the name of the message in WSDL. Used in RPC style messages.
        Parameters:
        messageName - Name of the message.

      • getMessageName

        java.lang.String getMessageName()
        Returns the name of the message in WSDL. Used in RPC style messages.
        Returns:
        Name of the message.

      • clone

        java.lang.Object clone()
        Performs a shallow copy of the SOAPMessage.
        Returns:
        Copy of the SOAPMessage.
